intro: Lithospermum leucophlaeum, commonly known as white lithosperm, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
